thread.title: Taylor Swift opens up about her illustrious friend group
thread.title_full: Taylor Swift opens up about her illustrious friend group - NY Daily News

author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: Taylor Swift opens up about her illustrious friend group
text:
Vogue Australia Taylor Swift spoke about her many friendships during an interview for the cover story in Vogue Australia’s November issue. Taylor Swift boasts one of Hollywood's most extravagant celebrity entourages — but the "Shake It Off" singer says it's pretty simple how most of her friendships get started.
"A lot of the time I'll reach out to people to tell them they're great, and a friendship will come out of them," Swift told Vogue Australia for its November 2015 issue.
The award-winning artist leads an illustrious squad of comrades that includes popular singers Selena Gomez and Lorde, comedian Lena Dunham and high-end supermodels Gigi Hadid, Cara Delivingne and Karli Kloss, among many others.
CHECK OUT OUR NEW APP: GET THE DAILY NEWS ON ANDROID OR IOS
Her enormous cast of high-profile pals has frequently joined her onstage throughout her acclaimed "1989" tour, and she calls her group of friends "one of my favorite things about my life right now."
"Our friends really have each other's back," Swift said. "It's the first time in my life that I've had anything strong like that in the friendship department."
View Gallery The many BFFs of Taylor Swift
Swift, 25, has also earned the adoration of her fans, who have constantly packed stadiums throughout her current world tour and made "1989" the best-selling album of 2014.
The singer realizes her popularity probably won't last forever, which is why she is always thinking of new ways to satisfy her followers.
"I am so lucky that people seem to like me right now but in no way, shape or form is it a permanent thing," she told the magazine. "And I think being aware of that is what keeps you on the game."
Kevin Mazur/WireImage Models Gigi Hadid and Martha Hunt, actress Hailee Steinfeld, model Cara Delevingne, singer Selena Gomez, actress Serayah McNeill and models Lily Aldridge and Karlie Kloss make up part of Swift’s illustrious squad.
That said, fans may have to wait a little while for the next Swift album to come out. The "Blank Space" crooner recently told NME magazine that she has nothing planned for after her current world tour wraps up on Dec. 12, but she expects to take a break once it's over.
"I think I should take some time off," Swift said. "I think people might need a break from me."
